reviews.review: the pacing was terrible, and it was a generally unpleasant experience. They failed to follow their own lore, they were doing far too much with far too little time.

Summary: The Rise of Skywalker is NOT a Christmas film.

Why does Disney think we want bittersweet endings?  The world is horrible enough as it is at the moment without adding yet more misery to it.  Why could you not redeem Kylo Ren/Ben Solo AND let him live?  Where's the Happy Ever After?

Adam Driver was WASTED in this.  He out acted everyone around him, including as Ben Solo when he said the grand total of one word which was "oof"

It gets half a star for the Reylo kiss and the Ben and Han scene.  The rest was a mess. The movie was shallow and inconsistent, lurching from fight scene to fight scene. No time for proper dialogue or character development.

I haven't been this disappointed by a film for years.
Una gran película para una gran saga

I went into this movie after seeing a lot of negative reviews, with an open mind. I'm a life long Star Wars fan and is a large part of my life. I absolutely disliked The Last Jedi, and this film seems to try and fix a lot of the issues the previous movie left. At the end of the day i thoroughly enjoyed this movie. I actually liked the fast pace, the non stop action, and old characters returning. I left the theater satisfied as a Star Wars fan, but there were a few things i wish they would have done differently. I recommend this movie if you're a true Star Wars fan.

Great way to end the Skywalker saga! The only downfalls to this movie was it felt a little rushed and I'm getting so sick of Disney's PC crap being shoved down our throats. Other than that it's Star Wars done right.
This movie is crap , built on crap and just proves all disrespect to the original storyline and all the fans who loved the original , do NOT waste your money for this trash !!!!!

The best I can put it is small moments of brilliance, packed in a cocoon of cluster-f@#kery.

As expected the visual, sound and music is what really keeps it up with the added nostalgia factor.

The story is a rushed mess.
It actually feels like they took everything they found on the internet, and threw it at the script. What didn't fall off of it made it in to the movie.

In terms of characters, they mostly fall flat. Adam Driver did probably most of the work here ... which isn't saying much considering that he played a very two dimensional character.

Logic is almost none existent at this point. I know people come to its defense saying that its a fiction, but with the thing is that even fiction needs to have rules and logic that makes sense in its own world, in order for it to work. Otherwise there is nothing keeping it from becoming chaotic. 

Most of what I saw today was an afterthought, considering how fast it goes trough story beats, and tries desperately to do damage control after TLJ.
Amazing thank you jj for finding a way to close out starwars and fixing Johnson mistakes.

This would have been better as 2 movies.  They tried to cram too much into one film.  Probably great if you just want to see fights and explosions.  Not enough character development for either returning or new characters.  Too many cameos which would be lost on folks not familiar w/ the 8 previous films. Very little dialog and some of that was barely worthy of a B movie.  Sadly, not a fitting end to this series.

I’ve been reading a lot of misconceptions on the internet about certain scene or ideas in the movie that are obviously explained in the movie if you pay attention. given the circumstances of episode 8 I think this movie does a good job of fixing the story and leaving it an a good place for now...lots to dive into in the future. The story truly represents the issues that come with redemption and stigmas, and does a good job in that sense but best saber fighting is still in the prequels.
